title: Node.js Best Practices
content:
Node.js Best Practices

Node.js is a powerful runtime for building server-side applications. Here are some best practices to follow:

1. Use Environment Variables

Always use environment variables for configuration. Never hardcode sensitive information like API keys or database credentials.

2. Handle Errors Properly

Implement proper error handling middleware in Express applications. Use try-catch blocks for async operations.

3. Use async/await

Modern JavaScript with async/await makes asynchronous code much more readable than callbacks or promises chains.

4. Keep Dependencies Updated

Regularly update your dependencies to get security patches and new features.

Following these practices will help you build robust and maintainable applications.
